alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:44PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN IRON AND CENTRAL ASHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 743 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Marengo, to Upson, to Hurley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ironwood, Ashland, Hurley, Sanborn, Mellen, Marengo, Saxon, Gurney, Upson, Gile, Odanah, Montreal, Kimball, Pence, Bad River Reservation, Gile Flowage, Cedar, High Bridge, Iron Belt, and Birch Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
